name: Anser anser
desc:en: Large gray goose. Rather bulky and overall brownish gray with a big pinkish-orange bill and pinkish legs. In flight shows extensively pale gray leading edge to upperwings, rather pale underwing coverts, and broad white tail tip. Compare to other gray geese, which differ in details of bill pattern and color, head and neck pattern, and have dark underwings. Inhabits lakes, marshes, and wetlands, and even urban parks in parts of its European range.
desc:nl: Large gray goose. Rather bulky and overall brownish gray with a big pinkish-orange bill and pinkish legs. In flight shows extensively pale gray leading edge to upperwings, rather pale underwing coverts, and broad white tail tip. Compare to other gray geese, which differ in details of bill pattern and color, head and neck pattern, and have dark underwings. Inhabits lakes, marshes, and wetlands, and even urban parks in parts of its European range.
desc:de: Große graue Gans. Eher massig und insgesamt bräunlich grau mit einem großen orange bis rosafarbenen Schnabel und blass rosa Beinen. Im Flug, Vorderflügel oberseits hellgrau leuchtend, eher helle Unterflügeldecken und breite weiße Schwanzspitze. Im Vergleich zu anderen grauen Gänsen, sind Details der Schnabelzeichnung und -farbe, Kopf- und Halsmuster sowie Farbe der Unterflügel (dunkler bei anderen) entscheidend. Bewohnt Seen, Sümpfe und Feuchtgebiete und sogar städtische Parks in Teilen ihres europäischen Verbreitungsgebietes.
desc:fr: Grande oie grise. Plutôt corpulente, plumage gris brunâtre, bec orange rosacé et pattes rosées. Sur l’oiseau en vol, grande zone gris pâle le long du bord d’attaque du dessus de l’aile, couvertures sous-alaires plutôt claires et queue terminée par une large bande blanche. Comparer avec les autres oies grises : motif et couleur du bec, motif de la tête et du cou et dessous des ailes foncés chez celles-ci. Habite les lacs, les marais, les terres humides et même les parcs urbains dans certaines parties de son aire de distribution européenne.
desc:es: Bastante común y con poblaciones en aumento en lagos, marismas y humedales en general, incluso en parques urbanos. Es el único “ganso” común como reproductor en la mayor parte de Europa, y a menudo menos asustadizo que otros gansos salvajes en la zona más norteña de su área de distribución. Bastante corpulento, de color grisáceo en la mayoría de su plumaje y con pico y patas rosados. En vuelo muestra el borde anterior del ala de color gris claro, infracobertoras alares pálidas y una ancha banda blanca terminal en la cola. Otras especies de gansos semejantes se diferencian de él por detalles del patrón y color del pico, cabeza y cuello y por tener partes inferiores del ala oscuras.
desc:eo: Large gray goose. Rather bulky and overall brownish gray with a big pinkish-orange bill and pinkish legs. In flight shows extensively pale gray leading edge to upperwings, rather pale underwing coverts, and broad white tail tip. Compare to other gray geese, which differ in details of bill pattern and color, head and neck pattern, and have dark underwings. Inhabits lakes, marshes, and wetlands, and even urban parks in parts of its European range.
desc:ru: Крупный гусь. Тело коричневато-серое, довольно плотное. Клюв большой и розовато-оранжевый, ноги розоватые. В полете видна бледно-серая полоса по передней кромке крыла, довольно бледное подкрылье, и широкая белая полоса на кончике хвоста. Отличается от других видов гусей окраской клюва и узором головы и шеи. Другие виды гусей имеют темное подкрылье. Встречается на озерах, болотах, и даже в городских парках в некоторых частях европейского ареала.

name: Anser albifrons
desc:en: Medium-sized goose with extensive range across the Northern Hemisphere. On adults note bright orange legs, white face, and variable amount of black splotching on belly. Bill color varies from orange to pinkish. Immatures lack white face and black on belly and have duller orange legs and bill. Superficially similar to domestic barnyard geese but smaller without the enormous pot-bellied appearance of domestic birds. Bill color is helpful to separate from both species of Bean-Goose and Pink-footed Goose. Also compare with very similar Lesser White-fronted Goose in Europe and Asia, which is smaller and more compact, and has a stubby bill and yellow eyering. Breeds in tundra and taiga habitats; winters in fields, agricultural areas, and wetlands. Usually found in flocks, sometimes mixed with other species of geese.
desc:nl: Medium-sized goose with extensive range across the Northern Hemisphere. On adults note bright orange legs, white face, and variable amount of black splotching on belly. Bill color varies from orange to pinkish. Immatures lack white face and black on belly and have duller orange legs and bill. Superficially similar to domestic barnyard geese but smaller without the enormous pot-bellied appearance of domestic birds. Bill color is helpful to separate from both species of Bean-Goose and Pink-footed Goose. Also compare with very similar Lesser White-fronted Goose in Europe and Asia, which is smaller and more compact, and has a stubby bill and yellow eyering. Breeds in tundra and taiga habitats; winters in fields, agricultural areas, and wetlands. Usually found in flocks, sometimes mixed with other species of geese.
desc:de: Mittelgroße Gans, brütet in der arktischen Tundra und überwintert in großen Scharen auf Ackerflächen und in Feuchtgebieten. Kleiner als Kanadagans mit leuchtend orangefarbenen Beinen und Schnabel, weißer Blesse und schwarzer Zeichnung am Bauch. Im Jugendkleid fehlen weiße Befiederung im Gesicht und schwarz am Bauch, Beine und Schnabel stumpf orangefarbene. Ähnlich domestizierter Gänse und Graugans, aber kleiner, und nicht so dickbäuchig wie Hausgänse.
desc:fr: Oie de taille moyenne qui niche dans la toundra arctique et hiverne en grandes troupes dans les zones agricoles et les zones humides. Plus petite que la Bernache du Canada, pattes et bec orange vif, face et front blancs, ventre taché de noir. Chez les immatures, la face n’est pas blanche, le ventre n’est pas taché de noir, et les pattes et le bec sont orange plus terne. Ressemble à l’oie domestique et à l’Oie cendrée, mais plus petite, n’a pas la silhouette très ventrue de l’oie domestique.
desc:es: Ganso de tamaño mediano que se reproduce en la tundra ártica y pasa el invierno en grandes bandadas en áreas agrícolas y humedales en el centro y oeste de EE.UU. Más pequeño que Canada Goose con patas y pico anaranjados brillantes, cara y frente blancas, y marcas negras en el vientre. Los inmaduros no tienen la cara blanca ni el negro en el vientre, y tienen patas y picos anaranjados más opacos. Semejante a los gansos domésticos (Graylag), pero más pequeños y sin la apariencia de la enorme barriga de las aves domésticas.
desc:eo: Medium-sized goose with extensive range across the Northern Hemisphere. On adults note bright orange legs, white face, and variable amount of black splotching on belly. Bill color varies from orange to pinkish. Immatures lack white face and black on belly and have duller orange legs and bill. Superficially similar to domestic barnyard geese but smaller without the enormous pot-bellied appearance of domestic birds. Bill color is helpful to separate from both species of Bean-Goose and Pink-footed Goose. Also compare with very similar Lesser White-fronted Goose in Europe and Asia, which is smaller and more compact, and has a stubby bill and yellow eyering. Breeds in tundra and taiga habitats; winters in fields, agricultural areas, and wetlands. Usually found in flocks, sometimes mixed with other species of geese.
desc:ru: Гусь среднего размера, гнездя́щийся в арктической тундре и зимующий большими стаями в сельскохозяйственных районах и на болотах. Мельче серого гуся, и имеет белое пятно в основании клюва. Похож на одомашненных гусей, но мельче и намного тоньше. Ноги и клюв ярко-оранжевые. На брюхе – черные пятна. У молодых особей нет белых перьев на голове, ни черных пятен на брюхе; ноги и клюв более тусклые, чем у взрослых.

name: Branta leucopsis
desc:en: Handsome and distinctive. A rather compact and fairly small goose with big white face patch, silvery upperparts, and black neck and breast sharply demarcated from white belly. Breeds mainly in Greenland, Iceland, and Spitsbergen, and locally around the Baltic Sea. Winters in farmland and grassy wetlands mainly in coastal lowlands throughout northern Europe. Free flying feral birds resident locally at lakes and parks in the U.K. In main wintering areas, occurs in hundreds or even thousands; elsewhere, singles and family groups can be found among flocks of other geese. Rare but increasing visitor to northeastern North America, almost always with flocks of Canada Geese.
desc:nl: Handsome and distinctive. A rather compact and fairly small goose with big white face patch, silvery upperparts, and black neck and breast sharply demarcated from white belly. Breeds mainly in Greenland, Iceland, and Spitsbergen, and locally around the Baltic Sea. Winters in farmland and grassy wetlands mainly in coastal lowlands throughout northern Europe. Free flying feral birds resident locally at lakes and parks in the U.K. In main wintering areas, occurs in hundreds or even thousands; elsewhere, singles and family groups can be found among flocks of other geese. Rare but increasing visitor to northeastern North America, almost always with flocks of Canada Geese.
desc:de: Häufiger, aber eher lokaler Wintergast auf Ackerflächen und Feuchtwiesen, vor allem in Küstennähe; brütet lokal auch an der Ostsee, als freifliegende verwilderte Vögel an Seen und in Parks Großbritanniens. In den Haupt-Überwinterungsgebieten in Scharen von Hunderten oder sogar Tausenden; anderswo Einzelgänger und Familiengruppen in Scharen anderer Gänse. Hübsch und markant, eine eher kompakte und ziemlich kleine Gans mit großem weißen Gesichtsfleck, schwarzem Hals und vom weißen Bauch scharf abgegrenzter Brust.
desc:fr: Espèce migratrice hivernale commune mais plutôt locale dans les terres agricoles et les zones humides herbeuses, principalement dans les basses terres côtières; niche également localement autour de la mer Baltique; au Royaume-Uni, des individus féraux en liberté sont résidents localement sur des lacs et dans des parcs. Dans les principales aires d’hivernage, on observe parfois des centaines et même des milliers d’individus; ailleurs, on trouve des individus isolés ou des groupes familiaux dans des troupes d’autres espèces d’oies. Oie assez petite et plutôt trapue, élégante et facile à reconnaître, presque toute la tête blanche, cou noir et poitrine noire nettement démarquée du ventre blanc.
desc:es: Invernante común aunque local en tierras de cultivo y pastizales inundados, principalmente en áreas costeras. Se reproduce localmente en el entorno del Mar Báltico, con poblaciones asilvestradas localmente en lagos y parques del Reino Unido. En las principales áreas de invernada aparece en bandos de cientos o incluso millares de ejemplares, pero se pueden encontrar individuos aislados o grupos familiares en bandos de otras especies de gansos. Se trata de un ganso compacto y bastante pequeño, con una gran mancha blanca en la cara; cuello y pecho negro, separados por una línea bien definida del vientre blanco.
desc:eo: Handsome and distinctive. A rather compact and fairly small goose with big white face patch, silvery upperparts, and black neck and breast sharply demarcated from white belly. Breeds mainly in Greenland, Iceland, and Spitsbergen, and locally around the Baltic Sea. Winters in farmland and grassy wetlands mainly in coastal lowlands throughout northern Europe. Free flying feral birds resident locally at lakes and parks in the U.K. In main wintering areas, occurs in hundreds or even thousands; elsewhere, singles and family groups can be found among flocks of other geese. Rare but increasing visitor to northeastern North America, almost always with flocks of Canada Geese.
desc:ru: Зимует в сельскохозяйственных районах и на травянистых болотах, обычно в прибрежных равнинах. Гнездится в некоторых местах в Балтийском регионе. Свободно летающие птицы живут круглогодично в некоторых городских парках и озерах. В главных районов зимовки, встречается сотнями или даже тысячами; а в других местах -- в одиночку или маленькими стайками совместно с другими видами гусей. Красивый и характерный вид, довольно компактный и мелкий. Имеет большое белое пятно на лице. Черные шея и грудь резко отграничены от белого брюха.

name: Branta canadensis
desc:en: A large brown goose with a black neck and white chinstrap. Overall size, bill size, and brown coloration variable across subspecies. Occurs in any open or wetland habitat, from city parks and golf courses to pristine marshes and Arctic tundra. Typically in flocks or family groups. Often seen in mixed flocks with Cackling Goose, especially in central and western North America. Canada Goose is almost always larger, longer-necked, and longer-billed than Cackling, although beware there is some overlap between the smallest Canada and largest Cackling. Abundant and widespread throughout the U.S. and Canada; rare in Mexico. Introduced and widely established in Europe. Listen for loud honking calls, especially as flocks migrate overhead in the classic V formation.
desc:nl: A large brown goose with a black neck and white chinstrap. Overall size, bill size, and brown coloration variable across subspecies. Occurs in any open or wetland habitat, from city parks and golf courses to pristine marshes and Arctic tundra. Typically in flocks or family groups. Often seen in mixed flocks with Cackling Goose, especially in central and western North America. Canada Goose is almost always larger, longer-necked, and longer-billed than Cackling, although beware there is some overlap between the smallest Canada and largest Cackling. Abundant and widespread throughout the U.S. and Canada; rare in Mexico. Introduced and widely established in Europe. Listen for loud honking calls, especially as flocks migrate overhead in the classic V formation.
desc:de: Schwarzer Kopf und Hals mit weißem Kinnband. Brauner Körper, mit regionalen Unterschieden im Farbton. Normalerweise in großen Scharen, Paaren oder Familiengruppen. Weidet an Land und gründelt unter Wasser nach Wasserpflanzen. Trompetender
desc:fr: Tête et cou noirs, mentonnière blanche. Corps brun, teintes variables selon les régions. Généralement en grandes troupes, en couples ou en groupes familiaux. Broute sur terre ou, dans l’eau, barbote en basculant le corps pour atteindre la végétation submergée. Cri : un honk sonore.
desc:es: Cabeza y cuello negros con una cinta blanca en la barbilla. Cuerpo café que varía en el tono geograficamente. Tipicamente en parvadas grandes, parejas o grupos familiares. Forrajea en tierra y en las orillas del agua para alcanzar vegetación acuática. Escucha sus fuertes
desc:eo: A large brown goose with a black neck and white chinstrap. Overall size, bill size, and brown coloration variable across subspecies. Occurs in any open or wetland habitat, from city parks and golf courses to pristine marshes and Arctic tundra. Typically in flocks or family groups. Often seen in mixed flocks with Cackling Goose, especially in central and western North America. Canada Goose is almost always larger, longer-necked, and longer-billed than Cackling, although beware there is some overlap between the smallest Canada and largest Cackling. Abundant and widespread throughout the U.S. and Canada; rare in Mexico. Introduced and widely established in Europe. Listen for loud honking calls, especially as flocks migrate overhead in the classic V formation.
desc:ru: Голова и шея черные, подбородок и щеки белые. Тело бурое; оттенок варьируется географически. Обычно встречается большими стаями, парами или семейными стайками. Пасется на суше и переворачивается в воде вертикально, хвостом вверх, чтобы дотянуться до растений, растущих на дне водоёма. Часто издает звук, напоминающий клаксон автомобиля.

name: Cygnus olor
desc:en: Huge white bird with long neck, reddish-orange bill, and black face. Adults have a black knob on top of the bill. Immatures are dusky brown with a gray bill. Native to northern Europe and Asia, but introduced in many regions, where it is now common on ponds, lakes, and calm coastal waters. Very aggressive toward native waterfowl. Often seen in pairs or small family groups.
desc:nl: Huge white bird with long neck, reddish-orange bill, and black face. Adults have a black knob on top of the bill. Immatures are dusky brown with a gray bill. Native to northern Europe and Asia, but introduced in many regions, where it is now common on ponds, lakes, and calm coastal waters. Very aggressive toward native waterfowl. Often seen in pairs or small family groups.
desc:de: Großer weißer Vogel mit langem Hals, rot-orangem Schnabel und schwarzem Gesicht. Erwachsene Tiere mit großem schwarzen Stirnhöcker. Im Jugendkleid dunkelbraun mit grauem Schnabel. Einheimisch in Nordeuropa und Asien, aber in vielen Regionen eingeführt, daher auch verbreitet auf Teichen, Seen und an ruhigen Küstengewässern. Sehr aggressiv gegenüber heimischen Wasservögeln. Häufig in Paaren oder kleinen Familiengruppen; in der Regel in kleinen Trupps.
desc:fr: Énorme oiseau blanc à long cou, bec orange-rougeâtre et face noire. Chez l’adulte, protubérance noire au-dessus du bec. Immatures brun mat et bec gris. Originaire d’Europe septentrionale et d’Asie, mais introduit dans de nombreuses régions où il est devenu commun sur les étangs, les lacs et les eaux côtières calmes. Très agressif envers les espèces aquatiques indigènes. Souvent observé en couples ou en petits groupes familiaux; habituellement en couples ou en petites troupes.
desc:es: Ave blanca muy grande con cuello largo, pico naranja rojizo, y cara negra. Los adultos tienen una
desc:eo: Huge white bird with long neck, reddish-orange bill, and black face. Adults have a black knob on top of the bill. Immatures are dusky brown with a gray bill. Native to northern Europe and Asia, but introduced in many regions, where it is now common on ponds, lakes, and calm coastal waters. Very aggressive toward native waterfowl. Often seen in pairs or small family groups.
desc:ru: Огромная белая птица с длинной шеей, красновато-оранжевым клювом и черным лицом. Взрослые имеют черный нарост в верхней части клюва. Молодые птицы имеют буроватое оперение и серый клюв. Родом из Северной Европы и Азии, но интродуцирован человеком во многих регионах, где в настоящее время распространен в прудах, озерах и спокойных прибрежных водах. Очень агрессивен по отношению к родным видам водоплавающих птиц. Часто встречается парами или небольшими семейными стайками.

name: Cygnus columbianus bewickii
desc:en: Learn about Tundra Swan (Bewick's): explore photos, sounds, and observations collected by birders around the world.
desc:nl: Learn about Tundra Swan (Bewick's): explore photos, sounds, and observations collected by birders around the world.
desc:de: Erfahren Sie mehr über Zwergschwan (bewickii): Entdecken Sie Bilder, Audios und Beobachtungen, die von Vogelbeobachtern weltweit eingetragen wurden.
desc:fr: En savoir plus sur Cygne siffleur (bewickii): explorez les photos, les sons, et les observations collectées par les ornithologues du monde entierLearn about Cygne siffleur (bewickii): explore photos, sounds, and observations collected by birders around the world.
desc:es: Aprender sobre Cisne Chico (paleártico): explorar fotos, sonidos y observaciones recopiladas por observadores de aves de todo el mundo.
desc:eo: Learn about Tundra Swan (Bewick's): explore photos, sounds, and observations collected by birders around the world.
desc:ru: Узнайте о Американский лебедь (Малый): фотографии, голоса и наблюдения, собранные по всему миру.

name: Cygnus cygnus
desc:en: Immense swan of frigid northern regions; breeds on the tundra, taiga, and steppe and winters in marshy lakes and wetlands, often in wild areas. Fairly straight neck, short tail, and sloping bill distinct from Mute Swan; told from smaller Bewick’s (Whistling) Swan by larger and pointed yellow patch at base of bill, also lower-pitched and more bugling calls. Juvenile often dingier through first winter than juvenile Bewick’s; juveniles of both usually found with adults as family groups.
desc:nl: Immense swan of frigid northern regions; breeds on the tundra, taiga, and steppe and winters in marshy lakes and wetlands, often in wild areas. Fairly straight neck, short tail, and sloping bill distinct from Mute Swan; told from smaller Bewick’s (Whistling) Swan by larger and pointed yellow patch at base of bill, also lower-pitched and more bugling calls. Juvenile often dingier through first winter than juvenile Bewick’s; juveniles of both usually found with adults as family groups.
desc:de: Sehr großer Schwan aus den frostigen Regionen des Nordens; brütet in der Tundra und überwintert in sumpfigen Seen und Feuchtgebieten, oft in Wildnisgebieten. Ziemlich gerader Hals, kurzer Schwanz und keilförmiger Schnabel, im Gegensatz zum Höckerschwan; Unterscheidet sich vom kleineren Zwergschwan durch größeren und keilförmig ausgezogenen gelben Fleck an der Schnabelbasis, auch tiefere, trompetende Rufe. Jugendkleid im ersten Winter oft
desc:fr: Énorme cygne des régions nordiques froides; niche dans la toundra et hiverne sur les lacs marécageux et les terres humides, souvent dans les régions sauvages. Cou assez droit, queue courte et bec de forme régulière contrairement à celui du Cygne tuberculé; se distingue du Cygne siffleur (bewickii), plus petit, par la tache jaune à la racine du bec, qui est plus étendue et pointue, et également par son cri plus grave et plus claironnant. Juvénile de premier hiver souvent plus terne que le juvénile du Cygne siffleur (bewickii); les juvéniles des deux espèces s’observent habituellement dans des groupes familiaux avec des adultes.
desc:es: Immense swan of frigid northern regions; breeds on the tundra, taiga, and steppe and winters in marshy lakes and wetlands, often in wild areas. Fairly straight neck, short tail, and sloping bill distinct from Mute Swan; told from smaller Bewick’s (Whistling) Swan by larger and pointed yellow patch at base of bill, also lower-pitched and more bugling calls. Juvenile often dingier through first winter than juvenile Bewick’s; juveniles of both usually found with adults as family groups.
desc:eo: Immense swan of frigid northern regions; breeds on the tundra, taiga, and steppe and winters in marshy lakes and wetlands, often in wild areas. Fairly straight neck, short tail, and sloping bill distinct from Mute Swan; told from smaller Bewick’s (Whistling) Swan by larger and pointed yellow patch at base of bill, also lower-pitched and more bugling calls. Juvenile often dingier through first winter than juvenile Bewick’s; juveniles of both usually found with adults as family groups.
desc:ru: Огромный лебедь. Гнездится в тайге и зимует в болотистых озерах и болотах, часто в диких районах. Довольно прямая шея, короткий хвост и прямолинейность верхнего края клюва отличают этот вид от Лебедя-шипуна. Отличается от более мелкого американского (малого) лебедя большим и заостренным желтым пятном в основании клюва, а также более низкими и более трубными криками. Окраска молодых птиц часто темнее, чем у молодых малых лебедей. Молодые птицы обоих видов обычно встречаются с взрослыми самого же вида семейными группами.

name: Alopochen aegyptiaca
desc:en: This striking “goose” (in actuality more closely related to shelducks) is native to Africa, mainly the eastern and southern parts of the continent; it has also been introduced widely across Europe and parts of the U.S. Distinctive: note the staring pale eye surrounded by a dark patch, pink legs, and overall gray and buffy plumage. In flight, look for bright white forewings. Usually found in pairs or family groups. Feeds while swimming and by grazing on shore.
desc:nl: This striking “goose” (in actuality more closely related to shelducks) is native to Africa, mainly the eastern and southern parts of the continent; it has also been introduced widely across Europe and parts of the U.S. Distinctive: note the staring pale eye surrounded by a dark patch, pink legs, and overall gray and buffy plumage. In flight, look for bright white forewings. Usually found in pairs or family groups. Feeds while swimming and by grazing on shore.
desc:de: Lokal eingeführt aus Afrika; häufig auch in Gefangenschaft auf künstlich angelegten Seen und im Wasserpark. Eine auffällige, merkwürdig gemusterte
desc:fr: Originaire d’Afrique, introduite localement; aussi espèce captive commune dans les collections des lacs ornementaux et des parcs aquatiques. « Oie » (en réalité plutôt apparentée aux tadornes) facile à reconnaître à son plumage surprenant, s’observe habituellement en couples ou en groupes familiaux. Se nourrit en nageant et en broutant sur le rivage. Remarquer la tache foncée sur l’œil, la poitrine chamois et le corps gris et brun; sur l’oiseau en vol, avant de l’aile blanc très visible.
desc:es: Es originario de África y se encuentra introducido en parques y jardines. Un ganso con diseño característico y algo diferente a las anátidas habituales (realmente más emparentado con los tarros), apareciendo normalmente en parejas o grupos familiares. Se alimenta tanto nadando como pastando en las orillas. Destacan el parche ocular oscuro, pecho leonado y en general cuerpo gris marronáceo; la parte anterior del ala es blanca y resulta muy llamativa en vuelo.
desc:eo: This striking “goose” (in actuality more closely related to shelducks) is native to Africa, mainly the eastern and southern parts of the continent; it has also been introduced widely across Europe and parts of the U.S. Distinctive: note the staring pale eye surrounded by a dark patch, pink legs, and overall gray and buffy plumage. In flight, look for bright white forewings. Usually found in pairs or family groups. Feeds while swimming and by grazing on shore.
desc:ru: This striking “goose” (in actuality more closely related to shelducks) is native to Africa, mainly the eastern and southern parts of the continent; it has also been introduced widely across Europe and parts of the U.S. Distinctive: note the staring pale eye surrounded by a dark patch, pink legs, and overall gray and buffy plumage. In flight, look for bright white forewings. Usually found in pairs or family groups. Feeds while swimming and by grazing on shore.

name: Tadorna tadorna
desc:en: Distinctive, large, rather gooselike duck of coastal wetlands, tidal mudflats, and nearby grassy fields. Striking plumage often looks simply black-and-white; at close range, head is deep glossy green, broad breast band dark rusty. Male has raised knob at base of red bill; juvenile duller overall, with whitish face and eyering. Less numerous and more local inland at lakes and along rivers. Often seen walking and grazing, at times in flocks.
desc:nl: Distinctive, large, rather gooselike duck of coastal wetlands, tidal mudflats, and nearby grassy fields. Striking plumage often looks simply black-and-white; at close range, head is deep glossy green, broad breast band dark rusty. Male has raised knob at base of red bill; juvenile duller overall, with whitish face and eyering. Less numerous and more local inland at lakes and along rivers. Often seen walking and grazing, at times in flocks.
desc:de: Unverwechselbare, große, eher gänse-ähnliche Ente der Küstenfeuchtgebiete, Wattflächen und nahe gelegener Wiesenfelder. Weniger zahlreich und eher lokal im Binnenland an Seen und entlang von Flüssen. Meist stehend und grasend, manchmal in Scharen. Auffälliges Gefieder erscheint oft einfach schwarz-weiß; erst aus der Nähe sind ein tief glänzender grüner Kopf und ein breites kastanienbraunes Brustband sichtbar. Männchen mit Höcker am Ansatz des roten Schnabels; im Jugendkleid insgesamt matter, mit weißlichem Gesicht und Augenring.
desc:fr: Gros canard ressemblant à une oie, facile à reconnaître, des terres humides côtières, des vasières intertidales et des champs herbeux qui les bordent. Moins nombreux et plus local à l’intérieur des terres, sur les lacs et les cours d’eau. S’observe souvent en train de marcher et de brouter, parfois en troupes. Plumage remarquable, semble souvent simplement noir et blanc; sur l’oiseau vu de près, la tête est d’un vert foncé lustré et la large ceinture est rouille. Chez le mâle, protubérance à la racine du bec, qui est rouge; juvénile plus terne, face et cercle oculaire blanchâtres.
desc:es: Distintivo anátida tipo ganso, grande, presente en humedales costeros, fangos intermareales y pastizales cercanos. Menos abundante y local en lagos y ríos interiores. A menudo puede verse andando y pastando fuera del agua, en ocasiones en bandos. Plumaje llamativo, aparentemente blanco y negro; a corta distancia puede distinguirse el color verde brillante de la cabeza y la banda pectoral de color herrumbroso. Los machos desarrollan un tubérculo nasal en la base del pico, que es de color rojo; los juveniles son más apagados en general con macha blanca en la cara y anillo ocular visible.
desc:eo: Distinctive, large, rather gooselike duck of coastal wetlands, tidal mudflats, and nearby grassy fields. Striking plumage often looks simply black-and-white; at close range, head is deep glossy green, broad breast band dark rusty. Male has raised knob at base of red bill; juvenile duller overall, with whitish face and eyering. Less numerous and more local inland at lakes and along rivers. Often seen walking and grazing, at times in flocks.
desc:ru: Отличительная, крупная утка, напоминающая гуся. Населяет прибрежные болота, приливные равнины, и близкие к ним травянистые поля.  В глубине материка, является менее многочисленным и спорадично распространенным в озерах и вдоль рек. Часто передвигается пешком, иногда стаями. Поразительная окраска оперения часто выглядит просто черно-белым; на близком расстоянии голова имеет темно-зеленый металлический отлив, и грудь имеет каштановую полосу. Самец имеет большой нарост в основании клюва. Молодая птица более тусклая, с беловатым лицом и кольцом вокруг глаз.

name: Spatula clypeata
desc:en: Medium-sized duck; smaller than a Mallard. Huge, spoon-shaped bill visible at a distance and in flight. Breeding males have dark green head, white breast, and chestnut sides and belly. Females buffy-brown with large, distinctive bill. Chalky-blue upperwing. Forages by sifting through the water, often swimming in spirals in groups.
desc:nl: Medium-sized duck; smaller than a Mallard. Huge, spoon-shaped bill visible at a distance and in flight. Breeding males have dark green head, white breast, and chestnut sides and belly. Females buffy-brown with large, distinctive bill. Chalky-blue upperwing. Forages by sifting through the water, often swimming in spirals in groups.
desc:de: Mittelgroße Ente; kleiner als Stockente. Großer, löffelförmiger Schnabel, auffallend weithin sichtbar, auch im Flug. Männchen im Prachtkleid unverwechselbar mit dunkelgrünem Kopf, weißer Brust und kastanienbraunen Flanken und Bauch. Weibchen hellbraun mit großem, markantem Schnabel. Kreide blauer Oberflügel. Durchsiebt das Wasser nach Nahrung, Gruppen schwimmen oft spiralförmig.
desc:fr: Canard de taille moyenne, plus petit qu’un Canard colvert. Énorme bec en cuiller visible de loin et en vol. Chez le mâle nicheur, tête vert foncé, poitrine blanche, flancs et ventre marron. Femelle brun chamois, gros bec distinctif. Couvertures sus-alaires bleu terne. Se nourrit en fouillant dans l’eau, nage souvent en groupes en décrivant des cercles.
desc:es: Pato de tamaño mediano; más pequeño que un Mallard. Pico grande en forma de cuchara visible a la distancia y en vuelo. Los machos reproductivos tienen cabeza verde obscuro, pecho blanco, flancos y vientre castaños. Las hembras son café-beige con el pico grande y distintivo. Azul blancuzco arriba del ala. Forrajea filtrando el agua al avanzar, a veces nada en grupos formando espirales.
desc:eo: Medium-sized duck; smaller than a Mallard. Huge, spoon-shaped bill visible at a distance and in flight. Breeding males have dark green head, white breast, and chestnut sides and belly. Females buffy-brown with large, distinctive bill. Chalky-blue upperwing. Forages by sifting through the water, often swimming in spirals in groups.
desc:ru: Утка среднего размера, мельче кряквы. Огромный веслообразный клюв заметен на расстоянии и в полете. Самцы в брачном наряде имеют темно-зеленую голову, белые зоб и грудь, и каштановые бока и брюхо. Самки светло-коричневые с большим отличительным клювом. Бледно-серые пятна на передней части крыльев. Кормится, просеивая воду клювом, часто плавая по спирали группами.

name: Mareca strepera
desc:en: Fairly large duck with extensive range across Northern Hemisphere. Males are mostly gray with a black rear end and puffy head. Also look for small white wing patch in flight. Females are similar to Mallard, but note thinner bill, plainer face, orange line along the edge of the bill, and white wing patch in flight. Typically found in pairs or small flocks in shallow wetlands, ponds, or bays, sometimes mixed with other species of ducks.
desc:nl: Fairly large duck with extensive range across Northern Hemisphere. Males are mostly gray with a black rear end and puffy head. Also look for small white wing patch in flight. Females are similar to Mallard, but note thinner bill, plainer face, orange line along the edge of the bill, and white wing patch in flight. Typically found in pairs or small flocks in shallow wetlands, ponds, or bays, sometimes mixed with other species of ducks.
desc:de: Gleich groß wie Stockente, aber mit dünnerem Schnabel. Das Männchen erscheint insgesamt grau mit einem kleinen weißen Fleck auf den Flügeln; Kopf größer als bei der Stockente, wirkt aufgeplustert. Weibchen ähnlich der weiblichen Stockente, aber dünnerer Schnabel, weißer Flügelfleck (manchmal sichtbar) und orangefarbene Linie am Schnabelrand. Gründeln an der Wasseroberfläche und unter Wasser nach Wasserpflanzen.
desc:fr: Même taille que le Canard colvert, mais bec plus fin. Mâle tout gris, petit miroir blanc sur l’aile; tête plus grosse et plus hérissée que chez le Canard colvert. Femelle ressemblant au Canard colvert; remarquer le bec plus fin, le miroir blanc (parfois visible) et la ligne orange le long de la bordure du bec. Barbote à la surface des plans d’eau et bascule le corps pour atteindre la végétation aquatique.
desc:es: Mismo tamaño que el Mallard pero con pico mas delgado. Los machos se ven grises por arribacon un parche blanco pequeño en el ala; la cabeza mas grande e inflada que la del Mallard. Hembra similar a Mallard; nota el pico mas delgado, parche blanco en el ala (visible a veces) y línea naranja a lo largo de la orilla del pico.
desc:eo: Fairly large duck with extensive range across Northern Hemisphere. Males are mostly gray with a black rear end and puffy head. Also look for small white wing patch in flight. Females are similar to Mallard, but note thinner bill, plainer face, orange line along the edge of the bill, and white wing patch in flight. Typically found in pairs or small flocks in shallow wetlands, ponds, or bays, sometimes mixed with other species of ducks.
desc:ru: Утка размером с крякву, но с более тонким клювом и небольшим белым пятном на крыле. Самец в основном серый. Голова больше и более пухлая, чем у кряквы. Самка похожа на самку кряквы; обратите внимание на оранжевую линию вдоль края клюва. Собирает корм с поверхности воды и погружает голову под воду, чтобы кормиться растениями, растущими на дне.

name: Mareca penelope
desc:en: Breeding males are beautiful and distinctive with rich reddish-brown head, buffy forehead, pearly gray body, and pinkish breast. Look for large white wing patches in flight. Females are plainer warm brown overall, with a small pale bill. Very difficult to distinguish from female American Wigeon; note warmer brown head on Eurasian with little contrast between head, breast, and sides. Also look for dirty grayish, not bright white, underwings in flight, but this can be difficult to judge, especially at a distance. Widespread and common in Eurasia, breeding at northern latitudes and wintering south to central Africa and Southeast Asia. Typically in flocks on lakes and wetlands, often grazing in nearby fields. Regular winter visitor to North America, especially on the west coast, usually in very small numbers among flocks of American Wigeon.
desc:nl: Breeding males are beautiful and distinctive with rich reddish-brown head, buffy forehead, pearly gray body, and pinkish breast. Look for large white wing patches in flight. Females are plainer warm brown overall, with a small pale bill. Very difficult to distinguish from female American Wigeon; note warmer brown head on Eurasian with little contrast between head, breast, and sides. Also look for dirty grayish, not bright white, underwings in flight, but this can be difficult to judge, especially at a distance. Widespread and common in Eurasia, breeding at northern latitudes and wintering south to central Africa and Southeast Asia. Typically in flocks on lakes and wetlands, often grazing in nearby fields. Regular winter visitor to North America, especially on the west coast, usually in very small numbers among flocks of American Wigeon.
desc:de: Weit verbreitet und häufig in Eurasien; in der Regel an Seen und Sümpfen. Männchen mit rötlichem Kopf mit creme gelbem Feld auf der Stirn, perl grauem Körper und rosafarbener Brust. Weibchen sehr schwer von der Amerikanischen Pfeifente zu unterscheiden; grundsätzlich wärmeres Braun mit geringem Kontrast zwischen Kopf, Brust und Flanken. Schmutzig-graue, nicht hellweiße Unterflügel im Flug, können schwer zu sehen sein, besonders aus der Ferne.
desc:fr: Répandu et commun en Eurasie, généralement sur les lacs et dans les marais. Mâle, tête rousse et front beige, corps gris perle et poitrine rose. Femelle très difficile à distinguer du Canard d’Amérique; généralement d’un brun plus chaud avec peu de contraste entre la tête, la poitrine et les flancs. Chez l’oiseau en vol, tenter d’apercevoir les sous-alaires d’un grisâtre sale et non blanc éclatant, mais ce caractère peut être difficilement perceptible, surtout de loin.
desc:es: Ampliamente distribuido y común en Eurasia, vagabundo raro para Norteamérica. Más a menudo, individuos solitarios son vistos en compañía de American Wigeon en lagos y pantanos. El macho tiene la cabeza rojiza con la frente beige, cuerpo griseo perla y pecho rosado. La hembra es muy difícil de distinguir de American Wigeon; generalmente marrón más encendido con poco contraste entre la cabeza, pecho y flancos. En vuelo, presta atención al lado inferior de las alas que es grisáceo, no blanco brillante como en American Wigeon, pero esto puede ser difícil de determinar, especialmente a la distancia.
desc:eo: Breeding males are beautiful and distinctive with rich reddish-brown head, buffy forehead, pearly gray body, and pinkish breast. Look for large white wing patches in flight. Females are plainer warm brown overall, with a small pale bill. Very difficult to distinguish from female American Wigeon; note warmer brown head on Eurasian with little contrast between head, breast, and sides. Also look for dirty grayish, not bright white, underwings in flight, but this can be difficult to judge, especially at a distance. Widespread and common in Eurasia, breeding at northern latitudes and wintering south to central Africa and Southeast Asia. Typically in flocks on lakes and wetlands, often grazing in nearby fields. Regular winter visitor to North America, especially on the west coast, usually in very small numbers among flocks of American Wigeon.
desc:ru: Широко распространен и многочислен в Евразии. Встречается обычно на озерах и болотах. Самец имеет красно-коричневую голову с бледно-охристым лбом, жемчужно-серым телом и розоватой грудью. Самку очень сложно отличить от самки Американской свиязи; как правило, она имеет более теплый коричневый цвет и менее выраженный контраст между головой, грудью и боками. Обратите внимание на грязно-серые а не ярко-белые подкрылья в полете, но об этом может быть сложно судить, особенно на расстоянии.

name: Anas platyrhynchos
desc:en: A large duck, generally common and familiar within its extensive range. Males are distinctive with iridescent green head, yellow bill, chestnut breast, and gray body. Females are mottled brown with orange and black splotches on the bill. Found anywhere with water, including city parks, backyard creeks, and various wetland habitats. Often in flocks, and frequently mixes with other duck species. In North America, females can be tricky to distinguish from American Black Duck, Mottled Duck, and Mexican Duck where ranges overlap. Those species are all darker-bodied than Mallard. A good view of the wing can be helpful, too: white wingbars on the leading and trailing edges of the blue wing patch are bolder on Mallard. Frequently hybridizes with those species, which can be even more confusing. Any bird with extensive white in the tail or curled feathers above the tail has some Mallard genes.
desc:nl: A large duck, generally common and familiar within its extensive range. Males are distinctive with iridescent green head, yellow bill, chestnut breast, and gray body. Females are mottled brown with orange and black splotches on the bill. Found anywhere with water, including city parks, backyard creeks, and various wetland habitats. Often in flocks, and frequently mixes with other duck species. In North America, females can be tricky to distinguish from American Black Duck, Mottled Duck, and Mexican Duck where ranges overlap. Those species are all darker-bodied than Mallard. A good view of the wing can be helpful, too: white wingbars on the leading and trailing edges of the blue wing patch are bolder on Mallard. Frequently hybridizes with those species, which can be even more confusing. Any bird with extensive white in the tail or curled feathers above the tail has some Mallard genes.
desc:de: Die typische Ente in ihrem Verbreitungsgebiet, an jedem Ort mit Wasser zu finden, einschließlich Stadtpark, Bach im Garten und in diversen Feuchtgebieten. Das Männchen hat einen grünen Kopf, eine kastanienbraune Brust und einen grauen Körper. Das Weibchen ist braun gefleckt mit oranger und schwarzer Zeichnung am Schnabel. Weiße Flügelbänder an der Ober- und Unterseite eines blauen Flügelflecks sind im Vergleich zu denen der Amerikanischen Dunkelente und der Mexikostockente deutlich ausgeprägter.
desc:fr: Canard typique dans son aire de distribution, présent partout près de l’eau : parcs urbains, ruisseaux d’arrière-cour et divers habitats humides. Mâle, tête verte, poitrine marron et corps gris. Femelle brun tacheté, bec orange à grosses taches noires. À l’avant et à l’arrière du miroir bleu, barres alaires blanches plus visibles que chez le Canard noir et le Canard brun.
desc:es: El típico pato dentro de su rango, se encuentra en cualquier lugar donde hay agua, incluyendo parques de ciudades, arroyos en el jardín y diferentes humedales. Los machos tienen cabeza verde, pecho castaño y cuerpo gris. Las hembras son marrones moteadas con manchas anaranjadas y negras en el pico. Las barras blancas enfrente y atrás del parche azul del ala son más conspicuas comparadas a las de American Black Duck y el Mottled Duck.
desc:eo: A large duck, generally common and familiar within its extensive range. Males are distinctive with iridescent green head, yellow bill, chestnut breast, and gray body. Females are mottled brown with orange and black splotches on the bill. Found anywhere with water, including city parks, backyard creeks, and various wetland habitats. Often in flocks, and frequently mixes with other duck species. In North America, females can be tricky to distinguish from American Black Duck, Mottled Duck, and Mexican Duck where ranges overlap. Those species are all darker-bodied than Mallard. A good view of the wing can be helpful, too: white wingbars on the leading and trailing edges of the blue wing patch are bolder on Mallard. Frequently hybridizes with those species, which can be even more confusing. Any bird with extensive white in the tail or curled feathers above the tail has some Mallard genes.
desc:ru: Самая известная утка в своем ареале, встречающаяся где угодно с водой, включая в городских парках, больших озерах, и различных заболоченных или влажных местах. Самец имеет зеленую голову, каштановую грудь и серое тело. Самка пятнисто-коричневые с оранжевыми и черными пятнами на клюве. Обратите внимание на белые полосы на переднем и заднем краях синего пятна крыла. В Дальнем Востоке встречаются гибриды этого вида и черной кряквы.

name: Anas crecca
desc:en: Tiny duck with a petite, thin bill. Males have a brown head with a wide green swatch behind the eye, creamy speckled breast, and mostly gray body. Females are brown, darker overall than other dabbling ducks. Forages by dabbling and tipping-up to reach submerged aquatic vegetation. Also regularly walks around mudflats to feed.
desc:nl: Tiny duck with a petite, thin bill. Males have a brown head with a wide green swatch behind the eye, creamy speckled breast, and mostly gray body. Females are brown, darker overall than other dabbling ducks. Forages by dabbling and tipping-up to reach submerged aquatic vegetation. Also regularly walks around mudflats to feed.
desc:de: Winzig-kleine Ente mit einem zierlichen, dünnen Schnabel. Männchen mit braunem Kopf und grünem Feld hinter dem Auge, cremefarbener, gesprenkelter Brust und überwiegend grauem Körper. Weibchen braun, insgesamt dunkler als andere Gründelenten. Frisst Unterwasserpflanzen durch Kippen und Eintauchen des Vorderkörpers (gründeln). Sucht auch auf überschwemmten Sumpfwiesen nach Nahrung.
desc:fr: Petit canard à petit bec fin. Mâle, tête brune à large rayure verte derrière l’œil, poitrine couleur crème, mouchetée, corps presque entièrement gris. Femelle brune, teinte globalement plus foncée que chez les autres canards barboteurs. Pour se nourrir, barbote et bascule le corps pour atteindre la végétation aquatique submergée. Aussi, se nourrit fréquemment en marchant à proximité des vasières.
desc:es: Pato chico con pico pequeño y fino. Los machos tienen cabeza café con un parche ancho verde detrás de los ojos, pecho crema manchado y cuerpo principalmente gris. Las hembras son café, más obscuro por arriba que otros patos que se alimentan en las orillas. Forrajean por la superficie del agua y zambullen medio cuerpo para alcanzar vegetación sumergida. Tambien camina por lodazales para alimentarse regularmente
desc:eo: Tiny duck with a petite, thin bill. Males have a brown head with a wide green swatch behind the eye, creamy speckled breast, and mostly gray body. Females are brown, darker overall than other dabbling ducks. Forages by dabbling and tipping-up to reach submerged aquatic vegetation. Also regularly walks around mudflats to feed.
desc:ru: Крошечная утка с маленьким, тонким клювом. Самец имеет коричневую голову с широким зеленым пятном за глазом, кремовую пеструю грудь и в основном серое тело. Самка коричневая, вообще темнее, чем самки других видов уток. Погружает голову под воду, чтобы кормиться растениями, растущими на дне. Также часто гуляет по илистым равнинам, чтобы пищу собирать.

name: Netta rufina
desc:en: A diving duck of larger lakes and reservoirs, especially with fringing reeds. Male striking and unmistakable with large, rounded, rusty-orange head, long red bill, and black breast. Female rather drab but distinctive: dirty buff overall with pale cheeks, dark face, and rounded brown cap. In flight, both sexes show a thick white wing stripe and whitish underwings. Feeds mainly by dabbling and upending. A common feature of waterfowl collections in European town and city parks.
desc:nl: A diving duck of larger lakes and reservoirs, especially with fringing reeds. Male striking and unmistakable with large, rounded, rusty-orange head, long red bill, and black breast. Female rather drab but distinctive: dirty buff overall with pale cheeks, dark face, and rounded brown cap. In flight, both sexes show a thick white wing stripe and whitish underwings. Feeds mainly by dabbling and upending. A common feature of waterfowl collections in European town and city parks.
desc:de: Eine Tauchente auf größeren Seen und Stauseen, besonders mit Schilfbestand am Ufer; häufig auch Teil einer “Sammlung” mit anderen Wasservogelarten in Parks europäischer Städte und Großstädte. Ernährt sich hauptsächlich durch Gründeln. Männchen auffällig und unverwechselbar mit großem, rundem, rost-orangem Kopf, langem roten Schnabel und schwarzer Brust. Weibchen eher schlicht, aber markant:
desc:fr: Canard plongeur des grands lacs et réservoirs, notamment bordés de roseaux; aussi commune dans les collections d’oiseaux aquatiques des parcs urbains d’Europe. Se nourrit principalement en barbotant et en basculant le corps. Mâle, plumage remarquable et impossible à confondre; grosse tête arrondie orange rouille, long bec rouge et poitrine noire. Femelle plutôt terne mais facile à reconnaître : plumage brun délavé, joues claires, face foncée et calotte ronde brune. Sur les oiseaux des deux sexes en vol, large bande alaire blanche et dessous des ailes blanc.
desc:es: Es poco abundante y más frecuente en grandes lagos y embalses, especialmente aquellos con carrizales. También se encuentra en parques urbanos como especie doméstica. Habitualmente se alimenta en superficie e introduciendo la cabeza bajo el agua. Macho llamativo e inconfundible de cabeza colorada, grande y redondeada, pico largo y rojo y pecho negro. La hembra tiene el plumaje de color más uniforme pero destaca frente a otras anátidas: ante sucio en general con mejillas claras, cara oscura y capirote redondeado y marrón. En vuelo, ambos sexos presentan una ancha banda alar y partes inferiores del ala blanquecinas.
desc:eo: A diving duck of larger lakes and reservoirs, especially with fringing reeds. Male striking and unmistakable with large, rounded, rusty-orange head, long red bill, and black breast. Female rather drab but distinctive: dirty buff overall with pale cheeks, dark face, and rounded brown cap. In flight, both sexes show a thick white wing stripe and whitish underwings. Feeds mainly by dabbling and upending. A common feature of waterfowl collections in European town and city parks.
desc:ru: Нырковая утка, населяющая крупные озера и водохранилища, особенно с тростниками. Также встречается очень часто в коллекций водоплавающих птиц в европейских городских парках. Обычно погружает голову под воду, чтобы кормиться, а также ныряет. Самец поразительный, сложно спутать с какой-либо другой птицей. Имеет большую округлую ржаво-оранжевую голову, длинный красный клюв и черную грудь. Самка довольно тусклая, но отличительная. Ее окраска в основном коричневая, а имеет бледные щеки, темное лицо и округлую коричневую «шапку». В полете, и самец и самка имеют толстую белую полоску на крыльях и беловатые подкрылья.

name: Aythya ferina
desc:en: Mid-sized diving duck. Male distinctive, with dark rusty head, pale gray body contrasting with black breast, and broad pale bluish band on bill. Female rather nondescript: gray-brown overall with diffuse pale head markings. Note sloping forehead and dark gray bill with pale band near tip. In flight grayish overall (lacks bold white wing stripe). Inhabits marshy and reed-fringed lakes to open reservoirs; locally on the sea in winter, especially when lakes freeze. Locally in flocks, and often associates with winter flocks of Tufted Ducks. Feeds mainly by diving.
desc:nl: Mid-sized diving duck. Male distinctive, with dark rusty head, pale gray body contrasting with black breast, and broad pale bluish band on bill. Female rather nondescript: gray-brown overall with diffuse pale head markings. Note sloping forehead and dark gray bill with pale band near tip. In flight grayish overall (lacks bold white wing stripe). Inhabits marshy and reed-fringed lakes to open reservoirs; locally on the sea in winter, especially when lakes freeze. Locally in flocks, and often associates with winter flocks of Tufted Ducks. Feeds mainly by diving.
desc:de: Mittelgroße Tauchente. Bewohnt sumpfige und schilfumsäumte Seen, auch offene Stauseen; im Winter lokal am Meer, besonders wenn Seen zufrieren. Lokal in großen Ansammlungen, und oft mit Wintertrupps der Reiherente. Nahrungssuche tauchend. Männchen unverkennbar, mit dunklem rostfarbenem Kopf, hellgrauem Körper in Kontrast zu schwarzer Brust, und breitem bläulichen Band am Schnabel. Weibchen eher unauffällig: Insgesamt grau-braun mit diffuser, blasser Kopfzeichnung. Charakteristisch sind eine schräge Stirn und dunkelgrauer Schnabel mit hellem Band an der Schnabelspitze. Im Flug gräulicher Gesamteindruck (ohne kräftig-weiße Flügelstreifen).
desc:fr: Canard plongeur de taille moyenne. Habite les lacs marécageux et bordés de roseaux ou les réservoirs dégagés; en hiver, s’observe localement sur la mer, surtout lorsque les lacs sont gelés. Localement en troupes, se joint souvent à des troupes hivernales de Fuligules morillons. Se nourrit principalement en plongeant. Mâle facile à reconnaître, tête rouille foncé, corps gris clair contrastant avec la poitrine noire, bande bleuâtre pâle sur le bec. Femelle, peu de caractères distinctifs : plumage brun-gris, marques claires diffuses sur la tête. Remarquer le front fuyant et le bec gris foncé à bande claire près de la pointe. En vol, entièrement grisâtre (sans la bande alaire blanche très visible du mâle).
desc:es: Es bastante frecuente en todo tipo de humedales, desde marismas y lagos con carrizo a embalses abiertos. En invierno también es frecuente en el mar, especialmente cuando los humedales interiores se congelan. Normalmente se encuentra en bandos, a menudo asociados con bandos invernantes de Tufted Duck. Se alimenta principalmente buceando. El macho tiene cabeza rojizo oscuro, cuerpo gris pálido que contrasta con el pecho de color negro. El pico de color oscuro, presenta una ancha banda azulada. La hembra tiene un aspecto en general pardo grisáceo con marcas difusas en la cabeza. La frente forma un escalón con el pico y el pico de color gris presenta una banda pálida cerca de la punta. En vuelo tiene un aspecto grisáceo (sin banda alar blanca).
desc:eo: Mid-sized diving duck. Male distinctive, with dark rusty head, pale gray body contrasting with black breast, and broad pale bluish band on bill. Female rather nondescript: gray-brown overall with diffuse pale head markings. Note sloping forehead and dark gray bill with pale band near tip. In flight grayish overall (lacks bold white wing stripe). Inhabits marshy and reed-fringed lakes to open reservoirs; locally on the sea in winter, especially when lakes freeze. Locally in flocks, and often associates with winter flocks of Tufted Ducks. Feeds mainly by diving.
desc:ru: Нырковая утка среднего размера. Населяет как болотистые и окруженные тростником озера, так и открытые водохранилища. В определенных местах встречается на море зимой, особенно когда замерзают озера. Иногда собирается стаями, и часто встречается совместно с зимующими стаями хохлатой чернети. Ныряет, чтобы питаться. Самец отличительный; у него голова темного ржавого цвета, бледно-серое тело, контрастная черная грудь, и широкая бледно-голубоватая полоса на клюве. У самки окраска простая, вообще коричневая, с размытыми бледными отметинами на голове. Обратите внимание на наклонный лоб и темно-серый клюв с бледной полосой возле кончика. В полете выглядит вообще серой, без белой полосы на крыле.

name: Aythya fuligula
desc:en: Common in wetlands from marshy and reed-fringed lakes to open reservoirs; locally on the sea in winter, especially when lakes freeze. Boldly patterned male distinctive: black overall with bright white flanks (whiter than scaup) and floppy crest. Female dark brown overall with short crest, paler flanks, staring golden-yellow eyes, and often a messy white patch at base of bill. In flight, both sexes show bold white wingstripe.  Often in flocks in winter; feeds mainly by diving, but often spends much of day sleeping.  Widespread breeder across Eurasia, wintering to central Africa, India, and Southeast Asia. Rare winter vagrant to North America, where almost always found singly among flocks of scaup. Compared with scaup, Tufted Duck always shows very dark blackish back, and even nearly tuftless females are darker than scaup with more limited white patch on face.
desc:nl: Common in wetlands from marshy and reed-fringed lakes to open reservoirs; locally on the sea in winter, especially when lakes freeze. Boldly patterned male distinctive: black overall with bright white flanks (whiter than scaup) and floppy crest. Female dark brown overall with short crest, paler flanks, staring golden-yellow eyes, and often a messy white patch at base of bill. In flight, both sexes show bold white wingstripe.  Often in flocks in winter; feeds mainly by diving, but often spends much of day sleeping.  Widespread breeder across Eurasia, wintering to central Africa, India, and Southeast Asia. Rare winter vagrant to North America, where almost always found singly among flocks of scaup. Compared with scaup, Tufted Duck always shows very dark blackish back, and even nearly tuftless females are darker than scaup with more limited white patch on face.
desc:de: Häufige Ente in Feuchtgebieten an sumpfigen und schilfumsäumten Seen bis hin zu offenen Stauseen; im Winter lokal am Meer, besonders wenn die Seen zufrieren. Oft in Scharen im Winter; Nahrungssuche hauptsächlich tauchend, verschläft oft einen Großteil des Tages. Kräftig gemustertes Männchen ist unverwechselbar: schwarzer Gesamteindruck mit weißen Flanken und Schopf. Weibchen dunkelbraun mit kurzem Federschopf, helleren Flanken, leuchtend gold-gelbem Augen und häufig einem unordentlichen weißen Fleck am Schnabelansatz. Im Flug beide Geschlechter mit kräftigen weißen Flügelstreifen.
desc:fr: Commun dans les zones humides allant des lacs marécageux et bordés de roseaux aux réservoirs dégagés; en hiver, s’observe localement sur la mer, surtout lorsque les lacs sont gelés. En hiver, souvent en troupes; se nourrit principalement en plongeant, mais passe souvent une grande partie de la journée à dormir. Mâle facilement reconnaissable à son plumage contrasté : dessus noir, flancs blancs, huppe pendante. Femelle entièrement brun foncé, huppe courte, flancs plus clairs, œil jaune doré au regard fixe et souvent tache blanche indistincte à la racine du bec. Chez les deux sexes en vol, bande alaire blanche très visible.
desc:es: Es común en distintos tipos de humedales, desde ciénagas y lagos con abundante vegetación emergente a embalses abiertos; localmente marino durante el invierno, especialmente cuando los lagos se congelan. Se encuentra a menudo en bandos durante el invierno; se alimenta principalmente a medias profundidades, pero a menudo pasa la mayor parte del día dormitando. El diseño del macho es muy distintivo; en general negro con flancos blancos, cresta colgante. La hembra es marrón oscura con la cresta más corta y los flancos son más pálidos que en el macho. Los ojos son de color amarillo vivo y a menudo tiene una pequeña mancha blanca en la base del pico. En vuelo ambos sexos presentan banda alar blanca.
desc:eo: Common in wetlands from marshy and reed-fringed lakes to open reservoirs; locally on the sea in winter, especially when lakes freeze. Boldly patterned male distinctive: black overall with bright white flanks (whiter than scaup) and floppy crest. Female dark brown overall with short crest, paler flanks, staring golden-yellow eyes, and often a messy white patch at base of bill. In flight, both sexes show bold white wingstripe.  Often in flocks in winter; feeds mainly by diving, but often spends much of day sleeping.  Widespread breeder across Eurasia, wintering to central Africa, India, and Southeast Asia. Rare winter vagrant to North America, where almost always found singly among flocks of scaup. Compared with scaup, Tufted Duck always shows very dark blackish back, and even nearly tuftless females are darker than scaup with more limited white patch on face.
desc:ru: Распространенная утка, населяющая как и болотистые и окаймлённые тростником озера, та и открытые водоемы. Зимой часто собирается стаями; в определенных местах встречается на море, особенно когда замерзают озера. Ныряет, чтобы питаться; часто спит днем. Самец отличительный, с контрастной окраской, в основном черной, а бока – белые. На голове длинный висящий хохол. Самка вообще темно-коричневая с коротким хохлом, бледными боками, золотисто-желтыми глазами, и часто размытым белым пятном в основании клюва. В полете, и самец и самка имеют толстую белую полоску на крыльях.

name: Bucephala clangula
desc:en: A striking medium-sized duck. Widespread across much of North America, Europe, and Asia, where it is found in a variety of wetland habitats. Breeds on lakes, ponds, and marshes, and winters on inland lakes and rivers or coastal bays and nearshore waters. Adult males have a black head with circular white patch at the base of the bill and a mostly white body with limited black. Females and first-year males have gray body and chocolate brown head. Bright yellow eyes usually stand out on all but first-year females. Very similar to Barrow’s Goldeneye. Males are easiest: Common has less black on the back, lacks a dark spur on the side, and has a circular (not crescent-shaped) white patch on the face. Females can be very difficult. Common usually has a dark bill with a small yellow patch near the tip, but rarely can have an entirely dull yellowish bill like Barrow’s. Head and bill shape are important: Common has more evenly rounded head with a peak in the center of the crown, and a longer, straighter-edged bill.
desc:nl: A striking medium-sized duck. Widespread across much of North America, Europe, and Asia, where it is found in a variety of wetland habitats. Breeds on lakes, ponds, and marshes, and winters on inland lakes and rivers or coastal bays and nearshore waters. Adult males have a black head with circular white patch at the base of the bill and a mostly white body with limited black. Females and first-year males have gray body and chocolate brown head. Bright yellow eyes usually stand out on all but first-year females. Very similar to Barrow’s Goldeneye. Males are easiest: Common has less black on the back, lacks a dark spur on the side, and has a circular (not crescent-shaped) white patch on the face. Females can be very difficult. Common usually has a dark bill with a small yellow patch near the tip, but rarely can have an entirely dull yellowish bill like Barrow’s. Head and bill shape are important: Common has more evenly rounded head with a peak in the center of the crown, and a longer, straighter-edged bill.
desc:de: Große Ente; etwa Größe einer Stockente. Männchen im Prachtkleid mit schwarzem Kopf mit grünem Glanz und kreisförmigem weißem Fleck am Schnabelansatz, schwarzem Rücken und weißem Körper. Weibchen und einjähriges Männchen mit grauem Körper und schokoladen-braunem Kopf. Leuchtend gelbe Augen. Häufiger Wintergast an eisfreien Binnengewässern, brütet in nördlichen Gebieten; ernährt sich von Muscheln und anderen wirbellosen Wassertieren.
desc:fr: Gros canard, à peu près de la taille du Canard colvert. Mâle nicheur, tête noire et grosse tache circulaire à la base du bec, dos noir et reste du corps blanc. Femelle et mâle de première année, corps gris et tête brun chocolat. Yeux jaune vif. En hiver, s’observe sur les deux côtes des États-Unis et du Canada ainsi que sur les Grands Lacs où il se nourrit de moules et d’autres invertébrés aquatiques.
desc:es: Pato grande; aproximadamente del tamaño de un Mallard. Los machos en plumaje reproductivo tienen la cabeza negra con un parche blanco circular en la base del pico, espalda negra y cuerpo blanco. Las hembras y los machos en primer año tienen cuerpo gris y cabeza color chocolate. Ojos amarillos brillantes. Es encontrado a lo largo de ambas costas de Estados Unidos y Canadá, y en los Grandes Lagos en los meses de invierno, alimentándose de mejillones y otros invertebrados acuáticos.
desc:eo: A striking medium-sized duck. Widespread across much of North America, Europe, and Asia, where it is found in a variety of wetland habitats. Breeds on lakes, ponds, and marshes, and winters on inland lakes and rivers or coastal bays and nearshore waters. Adult males have a black head with circular white patch at the base of the bill and a mostly white body with limited black. Females and first-year males have gray body and chocolate brown head. Bright yellow eyes usually stand out on all but first-year females. Very similar to Barrow’s Goldeneye. Males are easiest: Common has less black on the back, lacks a dark spur on the side, and has a circular (not crescent-shaped) white patch on the face. Females can be very difficult. Common usually has a dark bill with a small yellow patch near the tip, but rarely can have an entirely dull yellowish bill like Barrow’s. Head and bill shape are important: Common has more evenly rounded head with a peak in the center of the crown, and a longer, straighter-edged bill.
desc:ru: Нырковая утка среднего размера, чуть мельче кряквы. Глаза ярко-желтые. Самец в брачном наряде имеет черную голову с округлым белым пятном перед глазом, черной спиной, и белым телом. Самка и молодой самец имеют серое тело и шоколадно-бурую голову. Зимой встречается так и в море, как и в реках и озерах, питаясь мидиями и другими водными беспозвоночными.

name: Mergus merganser
desc:en: Large duck with a sleek body and thin red bill. Breeding males have a dark green head and mostly white body with peachy blush on underparts. Females and immature males have rusty brown head and gray bodies with a cleanly demarcated white throat. Feeds in rivers, lakes, and large ponds by diving to catch fish. Hardy in winter, often staying as far north as open water permits.
desc:nl: Large duck with a sleek body and thin red bill. Breeding males have a dark green head and mostly white body with peachy blush on underparts. Females and immature males have rusty brown head and gray bodies with a cleanly demarcated white throat. Feeds in rivers, lakes, and large ponds by diving to catch fish. Hardy in winter, often staying as far north as open water permits.
desc:de: Große Ente mit schlankem Körper und dünnem roten Schnabel. Männchen im Prachtkleid mit dunkelgrünem Kopf und überwiegend weißem Körper mit pfirsichfarbener Röte an der Unterseite. Weibchen und junges Männchen mit rostbraunem Kopf und grauem Körper mit sauber abgegrenzter weißer Kehle. Taucht in Flüssen, Seen und großen Teichen nach Fischen. Winterfest, bleibt oft so weit nördlich, wie offenes Wasser es erlaubt.
desc:fr: Gros canard au corps élancé et au bec fin et rouge. Mâle nicheur, tête vert foncé et corps presque entièrement blanc avec un soupçon de pêche sur le dessous. Femelle et mâle immature, tête brun rouille et corps gris, gorge blanche nettement délimitée. Sur les rivières, les lacs et les grands étangs, se nourrit de poissons qu’il attrape en plongeant. Résistant à l’hiver, reste souvent aussi loin au nord qu’il y a des plans d’eau libre.
desc:es: Pato grande con cuerpo brillante y pico rojo pequeño. Los machos reproductivos tienen cabeza verde obscuro y cuerpo mayormente blanco, con un rubor durazno en las partes inferiores. Las hembras y los machos inmaduros tienen cabeza café-óxido y cuerpo gris con garganta blanca bien delineada. Se alimenta en ríos, lagos y pozas grandes, buceando para atrapar peces. Muy resistente en invierno, permanece tan al norte como lo permitan las aguas abiertas.
desc:eo: Large duck with a sleek body and thin red bill. Breeding males have a dark green head and mostly white body with peachy blush on underparts. Females and immature males have rusty brown head and gray bodies with a cleanly demarcated white throat. Feeds in rivers, lakes, and large ponds by diving to catch fish. Hardy in winter, often staying as far north as open water permits.
desc:ru: Крупная, стройная нырковая утка с тонким красным клювом. Самец в брачном наряде имеет темно-зеленую голову и в основном белое тело с розоватым отливом в груди. Самка и молодой самец имеют ржаво-коричневую голову и серое тело с четко отграниченным белым горлом. Питается в реках, озерах и больших прудах; ныряет, чтобы ловить рыбу. Выносливая утка, зимой часто оставаясь на севере, насколько позволяет открытая вода.

name: Coturnix coturnix
desc:en: Small pear-shaped gamebird. Breeds in taller grassland and grain fields from western Europe east to central Asia and winters in similar habitat in Africa, southern Europe, and South Asia. Rarely seen, and most often detected by male’s emphatic whistled
desc:nl: Small pear-shaped gamebird. Breeds in taller grassland and grain fields from western Europe east to central Asia and winters in similar habitat in Africa, southern Europe, and South Asia. Rarely seen, and most often detected by male’s emphatic whistled
desc:de: Kleiner Hühnervogel mit birnenförmiger Gestalt. Brütet in höheren Gras- und Getreidefeldern von Westeuropa über Ost- bis Zentralasien; überwintert in ähnlichen Lebensräumen in Afrika, Südeuropa und Südasien. Selten zu sehen jedoch häufig zu hören; zu erkennen am nachdrücklich gepfiffenen
desc:fr: Petit gibier à plumes à silhouette en forme de poire. Niche dans les prairies à herbes hautes et les champs de céréales, de l’Europe occidentale à l’Asie centrale; hiverne dans des habitats semblables en Afrique, en Europe méridionale et en Asie du Sud. Rarement aperçue, le plus souvent repérée grâce au chant du mâle, un sifflement accentué pit-tuilit (paie-tes-dettes) qu’il émet aussi la nuit. Lorsqu’on la surprend, s’envole brusquement des pieds de l’observateur avec des battements d’ailes vrombissants et de courts vols planés. Plumage cryptique, brun rayé et sourcil clair; chez le mâle, rayure noire sur la gorge. Ressemble beaucoup à la Caille du Japon, dont le mâle a la face beaucoup plus foncée; sur le terrain, il est probablement impossible de distinguer avec certitude les femelles, les immatures et les types domestiques (qui sont élevés pour la production d’œufs mais qui peuvent s’échapper).
desc:es: Es un visitante estival de altos pastizales y campos de cereal que inverna en África y de forma escasa en el sur de Europa. Raramente visible, normalmente se detectada por el energético canto del macho “pal-pa-la”, que puede ser emitido también de noche. Cuando es espantada, vuela con un fuertes batidos y cortos planeos. Tiene plumaje muy críptico marrón estriado con ceja pálida; el macho tiene una línea negra en la garganta. Muy parecida a la Japanese Quail, que es criada en cautividad para producción de huevos y que podría encontrarse algún ejemplar escapado. Probablemente ambas son imposibles de identificar con seguridad en el campo.
desc:eo: Small pear-shaped gamebird. Breeds in taller grassland and grain fields from western Europe east to central Asia and winters in similar habitat in Africa, southern Europe, and South Asia. Rarely seen, and most often detected by male’s emphatic whistled
desc:ru: Маленькая грушевидная птица. Гнездится на лугах с высокой травой и в зерновых полях от Западной Европы до восточной части Центральной Азии и зимует в аналогичной среде обитания в Африке, Южной Европе и Южной Азии. Очень скрытный, и чаще всего обнаруживается только благодаря свистящей песне из трех нот. Пение иногда слышится ночью. Испуганный, перепел взлетает внезапно на близком расстоянии с жужжащими взмахами крыльев, с короткими периодами скольжения. Покровительственная окраска коричневая, тонко полосатая. Бровь бледная; у самца черная полоса на горле. Обыкновенный перепел очень похож на немого перепела, но лицо самца намного бледнее. Самку, молодого самца, и одомашненные особи (которые иногда встречаются в природе) наверно невозможно от немого перепела отличить.

name: Phasianus colchicus
desc:en: Exceptionally long, pointed tail sets pheasant apart from other chicken-like birds. Typical male is beautifully patterned in orange, gold, and gray, with red facial skin and an obvious white ring around the neck. Green subspecies, endemic to Japan, is no less beautiful and very distinctive with entirely iridescent emerald body and pale aqua-colored rump and shoulder. Females are entirely buffy-brown with intricate spotted and scalloped pattern. Inhabits fields, hedgerows, and brushy areas. Native to Asia and now well-established across much of Europe, North America, and New Zealand.
desc:nl: Exceptionally long, pointed tail sets pheasant apart from other chicken-like birds. Typical male is beautifully patterned in orange, gold, and gray, with red facial skin and an obvious white ring around the neck. Green subspecies, endemic to Japan, is no less beautiful and very distinctive with entirely iridescent emerald body and pale aqua-colored rump and shoulder. Females are entirely buffy-brown with intricate spotted and scalloped pattern. Inhabits fields, hedgerows, and brushy areas. Native to Asia and now well-established across much of Europe, North America, and New Zealand.
desc:de: Ein außergewöhnlich langer, spitz-zulaufender Schwanz unterscheidet den Fasan von anderen hühnerähnlichen Vögeln. Männchen wunderschön in Orange, Gold und Grau gemustert. Männchen mit roter Gesichtshaut und weißem Ring um Hals. Weibchen matter beigebraun. Bewohnt Felder, Hecken und Gestrüpp. Aus Eurasien in viele Gebiete eingeführt.
desc:fr: Les faisans se distinguent facilement des autres espèces apparentées par leur queue extrêmement longue et pointue. Mâle, élégant plumage à motifs orange, dorés et gris. Chez le mâle, la peau rouge de la face et le collier blanc sont très visibles. Femelle brun chamois plus terne. Occupe les champs, les haies et les endroits buissonneux. Introduit d’Eurasie dans de nombreuses régions.
desc:es: Cola excepcionalmente larga y puntiaguda separa el faisán de otras aves parecidas a las gallinas. Los machos tienen un plumaje hermoso de colores naranja, oro y gris. La piel facial roja y el anillo blanco alrededor del cuello son obvios en el macho. Las hembras son más opacas con diferentes tonalidades de marrón. Habita zonas agrícolas y matorrales. Introducido en muchas áreas desde Eurasia.
desc:eo: Exceptionally long, pointed tail sets pheasant apart from other chicken-like birds. Typical male is beautifully patterned in orange, gold, and gray, with red facial skin and an obvious white ring around the neck. Green subspecies, endemic to Japan, is no less beautiful and very distinctive with entirely iridescent emerald body and pale aqua-colored rump and shoulder. Females are entirely buffy-brown with intricate spotted and scalloped pattern. Inhabits fields, hedgerows, and brushy areas. Native to Asia and now well-established across much of Europe, North America, and New Zealand.
desc:ru: Исключительно длинный острый хвост отличает фазана от других курообразных птиц. Самец красиво украшен оранжевым, золотым и серым; красная кожа на лице и белое кольцо вокруг шеи сразу замечаются. Самка охристо-коричневая. Фазан населяет поля и кустарники. Родом из Евразии; введен во многие районы мира.

name: Perdix perdix
desc:en: Rotund chickenlike bird with salmon-colored face and thick rusty streaks on sides. Look for dark belly patch, which is obvious on male but reduced or lacking on female. In flight, look for bright orangey tail. Widespread and fairly common throughout much of Europe and central Asia, although populations declining in many areas. Introduced and well-established in North America, primarily in the west but also locally to eastern Canada. Look for flocks on the ground in open areas, especially agricultural fields and edges. Shy and inconspicuous; can be difficult to spot.
desc:nl: Rotund chickenlike bird with salmon-colored face and thick rusty streaks on sides. Look for dark belly patch, which is obvious on male but reduced or lacking on female. In flight, look for bright orangey tail. Widespread and fairly common throughout much of Europe and central Asia, although populations declining in many areas. Introduced and well-established in North America, primarily in the west but also locally to eastern Canada. Look for flocks on the ground in open areas, especially agricultural fields and edges. Shy and inconspicuous; can be difficult to spot.
desc:de: Wachtelartiger Vogel; in kleinen Gruppen vor allem auf landwirtschaftlichen Feldern und an Feldrändern. Insgesamt eher plump, graubraun mit lachsfarbenem Gesicht und unterbrochenen, rotbraunen Streifen an den Seiten. Männchen mit dunkelbraunem Bauchfleck; Weibchen im Allgemeinen mit verwaschenem Gefieder. Im Flug rotbraune Schwanzränder. Einheimisch in Eurasien; hat in Europa extrem abgenommen aufgrund von Änderungen in der Landwirtschaft; meist in kleinen Familienverbänden.
desc:fr: Semblable à un colin, s’observe principalement en petites troupes dans les champs cultivés et le long des lisières. Oiseau rondelet, presque entièrement brun gris, face saumon et barres rousses interrompues sur les flancs. Seul le mâle a une tache foncée sur le ventre; teinte généralement plus délavée chez la femelle. Sur l’oiseau en vol, tenter de voir les bordures rousses de la queue. Originaire d’Eurasie et introduite en Amérique du Nord, principalement le long de la frontière Canada-États-Unis.
desc:es: Ave parecida a una codorniz, encontrada en pequeñas bandadas principalmente en campos agrícolas y bordes. Rechoncha, principalmente marrón gris con la cara de color salmón y estrías rufas rotas en los lados. Solamente el macho tiene el parche oscuro del vientre. La hembra generalmente es menos marcada. En vuelo, busca los bordes rufos de cola. Introducido en EE.UU. Nativo en Eurasia.
desc:eo: Rotund chickenlike bird with salmon-colored face and thick rusty streaks on sides. Look for dark belly patch, which is obvious on male but reduced or lacking on female. In flight, look for bright orangey tail. Widespread and fairly common throughout much of Europe and central Asia, although populations declining in many areas. Introduced and well-established in North America, primarily in the west but also locally to eastern Canada. Look for flocks on the ground in open areas, especially agricultural fields and edges. Shy and inconspicuous; can be difficult to spot.
desc:ru: Похожа на перепела. Встречается маленькими стаями в основном в сельскохозяйственных угодьях. Выглядит упитанной и вообще серо-бурой; имеет оранжевое лицо и каштановые полосы на боках. Только самец имеет темное пятно на брюхе; окраска самки более тусклая. Обратите внимание на каштановые края хвоста в полете. Родом из Евразии и введен в Северную Америку, в основном около границы между Канады и США.

name: Tachybaptus ruficollis
desc:en: Fairly common but often inconspicuous small diving bird of wetlands with bordering reeds and other vegetation. Often remains out of sight; less often out on open water (mainly in winter). Rather compact, with rounded head, puffy rear end. Seen mainly as singles and small loose flocks, often sleeping during the day. Breeding plumage often looks dark overall; in good light note dark rusty head and neck sides with yellow patch at base of bill. Nonbreeding plumage dingy pale brownish overall with dark cap.
desc:nl: Fairly common but often inconspicuous small diving bird of wetlands with bordering reeds and other vegetation. Often remains out of sight; less often out on open water (mainly in winter).
